alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 9:24PM EST until January 06 at 6:36AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. For the Neuse River...including Smithfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River At Smithfield. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. At 18.0 feet, The Smithfield town park and the Neuse Riverwalk at the US70 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Tuesday was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 6.1 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 09/17/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Sat Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 17.9 Tue 8 pm EST 14.9 9.6 7.5 6.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 930 AM EST.
